name: Sadie G. Koninsky
description: '''Sadie G. Koninsky''' (August 1879 â€“ January 2, 1952) was an American [[composer]], [[Music publisher (popular music)|music publisher]], and [[Music education|music teacher]] who lived most of her life in [[Troy, New York]].  A prolific composer, she is thought to have authored over 300 pieces of music, including [[Waltz (music)|waltzes]] and [[March (music)|marches]].  "Eli Green's Cakewalk", which became a popular hit when it appeared in 1898, was also the first [[cakewalk]] published by a woman.  Some of her work was published under her male pseudonym, '''Jerome Hartman'''.
